intro: Prantleia glabra, commonly known as the smooth prantle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. Prantleia glabra is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
